title: National Government Services Portal
description: National Government Services Portal of India provides single window access to services offered by the various Indian Government entities. This Portal is an initiative under the India Portal Project and has been designed and developed by National Informatics Centre (NIC), Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology, Government of India.

items.title: Apply for Unmarried Certificate, Tamil Nadu
items.description: Through the Tamil Nadu e-Sevai portal, individuals can apply for the Unmarried Certificate, which officially certifies that the applicant has never been married. This certificate is commonly used for visa applications, employment abroad, and marriage registration in foreign countries. The portal simplifies the entire process by enabling online form submission, document upload, and status tracking, ensuring transparency, efficiency, and convenience for applicants seeking this official verification.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for No Male Child Certificate, Tamil Nadu
items.description: The Tamil Nadu e-Sevai portal allows citizens to apply online for the No Male Child Certificate, an official document confirming that a family has no male offspring. This certificate is often required to access specific welfare schemes, inheritance matters, and social assistance programs. The digital service ensures an easy, quick, and transparent application process, allowing users to submit documents, verify information, and download certificates without visiting government offices.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Widow Certificate, Tamil Nadu
items.description: Through the Tamil Nadu e-Sevai portal, widowed women can apply for the Widow Certificate, an official document confirming their marital status. This certificate is essential to access government pensions, welfare programs, and financial aid. The online service simplifies the application and verification process, enabling easy submission of details and supporting documents. Applicants can track their status and receive their certificates digitally, ensuring convenience and transparency in service...
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Download Death Certificate Form in Patna, Bihar
items.description: This downloadable Death Certificate Form by the Patna Municipal Corporation allows citizens to register death events conveniently. The form can be printed, filled, and submitted to municipal authorities for obtaining an official death certificate. This service simplifies vital record management, ensuring residents can access essential documentation for legal, insurance, and family record purposes in an efficient and transparent manner.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Download Birth Certificate Form in Patna, Bihar
items.description: The Patna Municipal Corporation provides an easy-to-download Birth Certificate Form for citizens to register births officially. The form can be filled and submitted to the concerned municipal office to obtain a certified birth certificate. This initiative ensures accessible documentation services, helping residents easily register vital events and avail essential civic benefits linked to official birth records within Patna.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Marriage Registration, Bihar
items.description: In Bihar, applying for marriage registration involves submitting an application to the relevant Sub-Registrar's office, either online or offline, with required documents and fees. The process confirms the legal union of a couple and can be necessary for various government benefits and schemes.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Online Birth and Death Certificate Download, Puducherry
items.description: Residents of Puducherry can download birth and death certificates through the official government portal or at Common Service Centers. Users must log in, search for the required certificate using relevant details, pay applicable charges (if any), and download the digital certificate. This online service eliminates the need for physical visits, making it convenient and efficient to obtain legally valid vital records.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Correction in Birth Certificate, Punjab
items.description: This service enables applicants to request corrections in an already issued birth certificate in Punjab. The process requires filling out an application, providing supporting documents such as ID proof and the original birth certificate, and paying the applicable correction fee. Applications can be submitted online through the official portal, ensuring accurate personal information for legal and official use.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Income Certificate, Punjab
items.description: Punjab residents can apply online for an income certificate, a government-issued document that confirms an individual's annual income. This certificate is essential for availing benefits under various government schemes, applying for scholarships, securing fee concessions, or fulfilling eligibility criteria in official processes. It acts as proof of income for both legal and administrative purposes and ensures that deserving citizens receive income-based benefits and entitlements.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Issuance of Death certificate /Non- Availability Certificate, Punjab
items.description: Citizens can apply for a bilingual, digitized death certificate if the death has already been registered. If no death certificate exists, applicants can get a Non-Availability Certificate to enable the registration of the death through Delay Registration. This service ensures the proper legal documentation of death for administrative and official needs in Punjab.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Issuance of Birth Certificate /Non Availability Certificate, Punjab
items.description: This service allows citizens to apply for a bilingual, digitized birth certificate if the birth is already registered. If no birth certificate is available, applicants can obtain a Non-Availability Certificate, which serves as proof to register the birth through Delay Registration. The digital certificate is officially recognized for all legal and administrative purposes in Punjab.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Addition of Name in Birth Certificate, Punjab
items.description: Adding a name to a birth certificate requires submitting an application and supporting documents through the Connect Punjab portal or a Sewa Kendra. The application, along with the original birth certificate and other documents like a school certificate, passport, or immunization card, needs to be submitted, and a fee of ₹65 is payable.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply General Caste Certificate, Punjab
items.description: General  Caste certificate is a document which is issued by the Government to prove that a person belongs to a specific caste. Also, caste certificates enable the citizens to avail reservation of seats in legislatures, claim fees concession in schools and colleges, obtain special quotas in educational institutions and receive upper age limit relaxation for certain jobs.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Multiple Copies of Birth Certificate, Punjab
items.description: This service allows citizens to request multiple digitized copies of an already issued birth certificate in Punjab. It is particularly useful when original copies are lost or additional certified copies are needed for official work like school admissions, passport issuance, or legal documentation. Applicants can conveniently apply online by submitting basic birth details and required identification. The digitally signed copies are valid and recognized by government authorities.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Ujjwala Yojana Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: The Ujjwala Yojana Scheme in Rajasthan helps rehabilitate women involved in prostitution and prevents their children from entering unsafe environments. It empowers them to lead dignified lives by offering shelter, skill training, and education. Implemented through voluntary organizations, the scheme supports their reintegration into mainstream society, fostering independence and social respect.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Widow Remarriage Gift Scheme, Rajasthan
items.description: This scheme encourages the remarriage of widowed women receiving widow pensions by offering a financial gift of ₹30,000. Implemented by the Rajasthan Government, it aims to promote social acceptance of remarriage and provide financial support to women starting a new chapter of life. Eligible beneficiaries can apply online through the Social Justice and Empowerment Department portal.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Application for Grant on Marriage of Disabled Person, Uttar Pradesh
items.description: The Uttar Pradesh government offers financial support to disabled individuals for marriage. Applicants need to provide disability proof, marriage documents, and income details.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Couple Award Scheme to Promote Widow Marriage, Uttar Pradesh
items.description: This scheme encourages widow remarriage by offering financial incentives to couples who opt for it. Eligible individuals can apply online with necessary proof of marriage.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Application for Birth Certificate by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Maharashtra
items.description: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) issues birth certificates as legal proof of birth. Citizens can apply for a birth certificate online or at their respective ward offices by submitting the required details and documents.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care

items.title: Apply for Income Certificate, Uttar Pradesh
items.description: Residents of Uttar Pradesh can apply for an income certificate, which serves as proof of income for various government benefits, scholarships, and reservation schemes. The certificate is issued based on verified income sources and is crucial for availing financial assistance from government programs.
items.category: Births, Deaths, Marriages and Child care
